com.solvvy.util.collections

Class MoreLists

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.solvvy.util.collections.MoreLists

  • public class MoreLists
extends Object
    Much of the methodology in this class was inspired by, or even copied verbatim, from Haskell's Data.List library

      static <T> java.util.stream.Stream<org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.Pair<Integer,T>> encode(List<T> xs)
      Given a list, returns a pair iterable in which consecutive duplicates of elements from the original list are encoded as pairs (N E) where N is the number of duplicates of the element E.

      Given a list, returns a FluentIterable of lists such that the concatenation of the result is equal to the argument, all neighboring pairs in each sublist evaluate the given predicate to true, and no neighboring sublists can form a valid concatenation.

      Given a list, returns a FluentIterable of lists such that the concatenation of the result is equal to the argument, each sublist in the result contains only equal elements, and no neighboring sublists contain equal elements.

      • group

        public static <T> java.util.stream.Stream<List<T>> group(List<T> toGroup)
        Given a list, returns a FluentIterable of lists such that the concatenation of the result is equal to the argument, each sublist in the result contains only equal elements, and no neighboring sublists contain equal elements.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of elements in the list
        Parameters:
        toGroup - the list for which to group elements
        Returns:
        a list of lists such that the concatenation of the result is equal to the argument and each sublist in the result contains only equal elements

      • split

        public static <T> java.util.stream.Stream<List<T>> split(java.util.function.Predicate<T> p,
                                                         List<T> toSplit)
        Given a list and a predicate, splits the list on 1 or more consecutive instances of elements matching the predicate, omitting empty lists.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of elements in the list
        Parameters:
        p - the predicate to match the delimiter
        toSplit - the list to split
        Returns:
        a list of sublists split on elements matching the predicate

      • group

        public static <T> java.util.stream.Stream<List<T>> group(java.util.function.BiPredicate<T,T> p,
                                                         List<T> toGroup)
        Given a list, returns a FluentIterable of lists such that the concatenation of the result is equal to the argument, all neighboring pairs in each sublist evaluate the given predicate to true, and no neighboring sublists can form a valid concatenation.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of elements in the list
        Parameters:
        p - a predicate upon two elements that returns false when the elements should be split into different groups
        toGroup - the list for which to group elements
        Returns:
        a list of lists such that the concatenation of the result is equal to the argument and each sublist in the result contains only equal elements

      • span

        public static <T> org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.Pair<List<T>,List<T>> span(java.util.function.Predicate<T> p,
                                                                            List<T> xs)
        Given a predicate and a list, returns a pair of lists where the first list is longest prefix (possibly empty) of elements that satisfy p and the second element is the remainder of the list.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of elements in the list
        Parameters:
        p - the predicate to test on the elements of the list
        xs - the list of elements
        Returns:
        a pair of lists where the first list is longest * prefix of elements that satisfy p and the second element is the remainder * of the list.

      • encode

        public static <T> java.util.stream.Stream<org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.Pair<Integer,T>> encode(List<T> xs)
        Given a list, returns a pair iterable in which consecutive duplicates of elements from the original list are encoded as pairs (N E) where N is the number of duplicates of the element E.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of elements contained in the provided list
        Parameters:
        xs - the list to encode
        Returns:
        a pair iterable encoding the input list as number-element pairs

        Type Parameters:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a mapping of each unique element in the list to the maximum number of times it appears consecutively in the list.
